- *For a dungeon space, see [Square](/wiki/Square "Square").*

In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, a blank **space** serves the following purposes:

-   represents [ghosts](/wiki/Ghost_\(monster_class\) "Ghost (monster class)"):

  -   [ghost](/wiki/Ghost "Ghost")
  -   [shade](/wiki/Shade "Shade")
  - Some players use the [SYMBOLS](/wiki/Option#symset "Option") option to give ghosts and shades a different appearance, such as X or 8.

- A space also represents a dark part of a [room](/wiki/Room "Room"), [solid rock](/wiki/Solid_rock "Solid rock"), [air](/wiki/Air "Air") or an unexplored part of the dungeon.

* Press [space]() at the `--More--` prompt to get the next messages or screen.
* The [rest\_on\_space](/wiki/Rest_on_space "Rest on space") option causes the command [space]() to rest, the same as [.](/wiki/Dot "Dot"). This is generally viewed as extremely dangerous, as one too many presses of space as messages pass by can cause [YASD](/wiki/YASD "YASD").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Variants](#Variants)

  - [1.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [1.2 AceHack](#AceHack)
  - [1.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [1.4 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [1.5 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [1.6 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [1.7 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

## Variants

Some variants of *NetHack* change the glyph of ghosts for better visibility.

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") adds one new monster that uses a blank space as a glyph:

-   [shadow](/wiki/Shadow "Shadow")

### AceHack

In [AceHack](/wiki/AceHack "AceHack"), the ghost monster class is merged into the [wraith monster class](/wiki/Wraith_\(monster_class\) "Wraith (monster class)") to make them more visible to players. This is also applicable to [Nethack 4](/wiki/Nethack_4 "Nethack 4"), [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk") and [FIQhack](/wiki/FIQhack "FIQhack").

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") moves the shade to [its own monster class](/wiki/Shade_\(monster_class\) "Shade (monster class)") that is represented by a blank space as its glyph; the ghost [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") instead uses the [dot](/wiki/Dot "Dot"), ., as their glyph.

dNetHack adds two new monsters that use the blank space:

-   [broken shadow](/wiki/Broken_shadow "Broken shadow")
-   [voice in the dark](/wiki/Voice_in_the_dark "Voice in the dark")

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), the ghost monster class is merged into the wraith monster class to avoid using punctuation for monster glyphs and make them more visible.

### SpliceHack

[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") adds a new monster that uses a blank space as a glyph:

-   [spectre](/wiki/Spectre "Spectre")

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") adds a new monster that uses a blank space as a glyph:

-   [spectre](/wiki/Spectre "Spectre")

EvilHack also uses blank space tiles to represent [open air](/index.php?title=Open_air\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Open air (page does not exist)").

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), the ghost monster class is moved to the [eight](/wiki/Eight "Eight") (8) glyph.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Space

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt
For a dungeon space, see Square.

In NetHack, a blank space serves the following purposes:

  •   represents ghosts:
    •   ghost
    •   shade
    • Some players use the SYMBOLS option to give ghosts and shades a different appearance, such as X or 8.
  • A space also represents a dark part of a room, solid rock, air or an unexplored part of the dungeon.
  • Press space at the --More-- prompt to get the next messages or screen.
  • The rest_on_space option causes the command space to rest, the same as .. This is generally viewed as extremely dangerous, as one too many presses of space as messages pass by can cause YASD.

  • 1 Variants
    • 1.1 SLASH'EM
    • 1.2 AceHack
    • 1.3 dNetHack
    • 1.4 xNetHack
    • 1.5 SpliceHack
    • 1.6 EvilHack
    • 1.7 SlashTHEM

Variants

Some variants of NetHack change the glyph of ghosts for better visibility.

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM adds one new monster that uses a blank space as a glyph:

  •   shadow

AceHack

In AceHack, the ghost monster class is merged into the wraith monster class to make them more visible to players. This is also applicable to Nethack 4, NetHack Fourk and FIQhack.

dNetHack

dNetHack moves the shade to its own monster class that is represented by a blank space as its glyph; the ghost monster class instead uses the dot, ., as their glyph.

dNetHack adds two new monsters that use the blank space:

  •   broken shadow
  •   voice in the dark

xNetHack

In xNetHack, the ghost monster class is merged into the wraith monster class to avoid using punctuation for monster glyphs and make them more visible.

SpliceHack

SpliceHack adds a new monster that uses a blank space as a glyph:

  •   spectre

EvilHack

EvilHack adds a new monster that uses a blank space as a glyph:

  •   spectre

EvilHack also uses blank space tiles to represent open air.

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, the ghost monster class is moved to the eight (8) glyph.

rawPage:
{{ASCII}}
{{otheruses||a dungeon space|Square}}
In ''[[NetHack]]'', a blank '''space''' serves the following purposes:

* {{black| }} represents [[ghost (monster class)|ghosts]]:
** {{monsymlink|ghost}}
** {{monsymlink|shade}}
** Some players use the [[Option#symset|SYMBOLS]] option to give ghosts and shades a different appearance, such as {{white|X}} or {{white|8}}.
* A space also represents a dark part of a [[room]], [[solid rock]], [[air]] or an unexplored part of the dungeon.

* Press {{kbd|space}} at the <tt>--More--</tt> prompt to get the next messages or screen.
* The [[rest_on_space]] option causes the command {{kbd|space}} to rest, the same as {{kbd|.}}. This is generally viewed as extremely dangerous, as one too many presses of space as messages pass by can cause [[YASD]].

==Variants==
Some variants of ''NetHack'' change the glyph of ghosts for better visibility.

===SLASH'EM===
[[SLASH'EM]] adds one new monster that uses a blank space as a glyph:

* {{monsymlink|shadow}}

===AceHack===
In [[AceHack]], the ghost monster class is merged into the [[Wraith (monster class)|wraith monster class]] to make them more visible to players. This is also applicable to [[Nethack 4]], [[NetHack Fourk]] and [[FIQhack]].

===dNetHack===
[[dNetHack]] moves the shade to [[Shade (monster class)|its own monster class]] that is represented by a blank space as its glyph; the ghost [[monster class]] instead uses the [[dot]], {{white|.}}, as their glyph.

dNetHack adds two new monsters that use the blank space:

* {{black| }} [[broken shadow]]
* {{black| }} [[voice in the dark]]

===xNetHack===
In [[xNetHack]], the ghost monster class is merged into the wraith monster class to avoid using punctuation for monster glyphs and make them more visible.

===SpliceHack===
[[SpliceHack]] adds a new monster that uses a blank space as a glyph:

* {{black| }} [[spectre]]

===EvilHack===
[[EvilHack]] adds a new monster that uses a blank space as a glyph:

* {{black| }} [[spectre]]

EvilHack also uses blank space tiles to represent [[open air]].

===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], the ghost monster class is moved to the [[eight]] ({{white|8}}) glyph.
